meanings.definition: A diagram representing a tree, used in hierarchical clustering analysis.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the dendrograms to understand how the data points were connected.
meanings.sent2: In biology class, we learned how to interpret dendrograms to analyze evolutionary relationships.
meanings.sent3: The dendrograms at the conference looked like family trees for numbers!
meanings.sent4: The dendrograms in the report painted a clear picture of the data's hierarchy.
meanings.sent5: The dendrograms on the screen made the complex relationships easy to see.

meanings.definition: A visual representation of the relationships between data points in a tree-like structure.
meanings.sent1: She used the dendrograms to visualize the connections between different variables.
meanings.sent2: The dendrograms helped us see how the data points were linked together.
meanings.sent3: The artist created a unique painting inspired by the dendrograms she saw.
meanings.sent4: The dendrograms in the presentation illustrated the intricate web of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The colorful dendrograms brought life to the otherwise dull data analysis.
